definition: to argue needlessly/to waste time explaining
to cost/to spend/fee/wasteful/expenses
surname Fei
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
tongue

sentences.english: You are wasting your breath; he won't change his mind.
sentences.chinese: 你在白费口舌，他不会改变主的。

sentences.english: Bards will not spare breath upon your pitiful empire.
sentences.chinese: 吟游诗人将不会在你那可鄙的王朝上多费口舌。

sentences.english: You're wasting your breath. I won't change my mind.
sentences.chinese: 你不必多费口舌，我是不会改变主意的。

sentences.english: I've already made up my mind. There's no sense flogging a dead horse .
sentences.chinese: 我已经下了决心，不必再白费口舌了。

sentences.english: Asking him is wasting my breath.
Save your breath, the boss will never give you the day off.
sentences.chinese: 别白费口舌了，老板不会给你假的。

sentences.english: He won’t pay attention to anybody, you’re just wasting your breath.
sentences.chinese: 他对谁都不加理会，你不过是白费口舌。

sentences.english: He won't listen to anybody. You're just wasting your breath.
sentences.chinese: 他谁的话都不听，你只是白费口舌。

sentences.english: It was mere waste of breath to argue with a person in so unreasonable a state of mind.
sentences.chinese: 和一个如此不可理喻的人争论纯粹是白费口舌。

sentences.english: Offering unnecessary care would, in fact, be faster.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，医生提供不必要的诊疗反而不用多费口舌。

sentences.english: Save your breath; you'll never change her mind.
sentences.chinese: 别费口舌了，你永远改变不了她的主意的。

sentences.english: Don't waste words on that fellow.
sentences.chinese: 不要同那家伙白费口舌。

sentences.english: Ive already made up my mind. Theres no sense beating a dead horse.
sentences.chinese: 我已经下了决心，不要再白费口舌了。

sentences.english: Trying to reason with them was like banging my head against a brick wall.
sentences.chinese: 试图和他们讲道理只是白费口舌。

sentences.english: Save your breath; you'll never persuade her.
sentences.chinese: 不要白费口舌了，你说服不了她。

sentences.english: Don't waste your breath try to convince him; he's going to leave anyway.
sentences.chinese: 不要白费口舌劝阻他了，他反正也要走的。

definition: to argue needlessly/to waste time explaining
to wear out the skin of one's teeth (idiom); pointlessly blather/to talk incessant nonsense/blah blah
variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
to whistle down the wind/to waste one's breath (idiom)
lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
long-winded/wordy/troublesome/pesky/also pr. [luo1 suo1]
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to invite a snub/to court a rebuff
see 犯不著|犯不着[fan4 bu5 zhao2]
nonsense/rubbish/superfluous words/You don't say!/No kidding! (gently sarcastic)
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
to talk at length/to waste one's breath/variant of 廢話|废话[fei4 hua4]
to encircle/to go around/to circle/to beat about the bush
